item.title: Social Security Solvency and Sustainability Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.title: Defend and Save Social Security Act of 2012

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S3987-3989)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance. (text of measure as introduced: CR S3893-3894)

summary.text: Defend and Save Social Security Act - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act to: (1) increase the normal retirement age by specified graduated stages to 67 by 2019 and to 69 after December 31, 2026, and the early retirement age to 63 by 2019 and to 64 after December 31, 2022; (2) revise requirements for computation of the age increase factor; and (3) modify the cost-of-living adjustment (COLA) to 1% below the general COLA.

bill.title: Defend and Save Social Security Act

item.title: Defend and Save Social Security Act

A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to extend the solvency of the Social Security Trust Funds by increasing the normal and early retirement ages under the Social Security program and modifying the cost-of-living adjustments in benefits.
Defend and Save Social Security Act

latestAction.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S3987-3989)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
